title: The Poet X
author: Acevedo, Elizabeth*
my rating: 1 of 5 stars2 of 5 stars3 of 5 stars4 of 5 stars5 of 5 starsadd to shelves
review: I don't give out too many 5 Star ratings. This book was exceptional from various facets. (1) As a coming of age story, it tracked with my own experienI don't give out too many 5 Star ratings. This book was exceptional from various facets. (1) As a coming of age story, it tracked with my own experience as a 16 year old girl. (2) The language was lovely. (3) She deftly handles a bilingual story. (I just admired her sheer technique. ) (4) It was respectful of the Catholic Church while being honest. (5) Various characters had a chance to grow. (6) The ugly was not ignored and yet did not overwhelm. I was surprised by the explicitness of some of the passages. Even so: would I pass this book to my granddaughters? Yes. ...more
